diff_hunk:
@@ -230,6 +230,8 @@
 
 - func: slice(Tensor self, int64_t start=0, int64_t end=9223372036854775807, int64_t step=1, int64_t dim=0) -> Tensor
 
+- func: slice_dim(Tensor self, int64_t dim, int64_t start=0, int64_t end=9223372036854775807, int64_t step=1) -> Tensor
body:
It's to avoid having to specify end when you just want to slice to the end; you either need to specify 9223372036854775807 because we couldn't have self.size() as the default in C++ and often self is a result of another computation, so not trivial to just do the equivalent at the call site.

we should maybe just change the order of arguments in slice (usually we put dim at the end, so that's why it was there originally); I don't really have a strong opinion either way.

we should maybe just change the order of arguments in slice (usually we put dim at the end, so that's why it was there originally); I don't really have a strong opinion either way.
body_text:
It's to avoid having to specify end when you just want to slice to the end; you either need to specify 9223372036854775807 because we couldn't have self.size() as the default in C++ and often self is a result of another computation, so not trivial to just do the equivalent at the call site.
we should maybe just change the order of arguments in slice (usually we put dim at the end, so that's why it was there originally); I don't really have a strong opinion either way.
